title: American importers and consumers bear the cost of 2025 tariffs: analysis
summary:
A Kiel Policy Brief analyzes the 2025 US tariffs, concluding they are an "own goal" as American importers and consumers bear nearly the entire cost. The study, utilizing shipment-level data from over 25 million transactions valued at nearly $4 trillion, found that approximately 96% of the tariff burden is passed through to US buyers, with foreign exporters absorbing only about 4%. This results in "near-complete pass-through" to US import prices.

The analysis projects that the surged US customs revenue of approximately $200 billion in 2025 will be almost entirely a tax paid by Americans. Event studies on discrete tariff shocks, such as 50% on Brazil and 25-50% on India, confirm that export prices did not decline; instead, trade volumes collapsed. Indian export customs data validates these findings, showing that Indian exporters maintained their prices and reduced shipments when facing US tariffs, rather than absorbing the cost. Authors Hinz, Lohmann, and Mahlkow from the Kiel Institute highlight that these tariffs directly burden US businesses and consumers.
chinese_title: 美国进口商和消费者承担2025年关税成本：分析
chinese_summary:
基尔政策简报分析了2025年美国关税，结论是这些关税是一个“乌龙球”，因为美国进口商和消费者几乎承担了全部成本。这项研究利用了来自逾2500万笔交易（总价值近4万亿美元）的货物层面数据，发现大约96%的关税负担转嫁给了美国买家，而外国出口商仅承担了大约4%。这导致了关税“近乎完全地”转嫁到美国进口商品价格上。

该分析预计，2025年美国将激增约2000亿美元的海关收入，而这笔收入将几乎完全是美国人支付的税款。对离散关税冲击（例如对巴西征收50%关税、对印度征收25-50%关税）的事件研究证实，出口价格并未下降；相反，贸易量大幅萎缩。印度出口海关数据验证了这些发现，表明印度出口商在面对美国关税时，维持了价格并减少了出货量，而非承担成本。基尔研究所的作者Hinz、Lohmann和Mahlkow强调，这些关税直接加重了美国企业和消费者的负担。

title: Dead Internet Theory
summary:
The author recounts an experience on HackerNews where an open-source project faced accusations of being AI-generated. Despite the project author's denials, the article's author observed AI-like linguistic patterns (e.g., specific em-dash usage, phrases like "you are absolutely right") in their comments, leading to profound uncertainty about the reality of online interactions. This experience triggered a recognition of the "Dead Internet Theory."

The Dead Internet Theory suggests that since roughly 2016, the internet is predominantly populated by bots and machine-generated content, largely for marketing and SEO purposes. The author contrasts this with their youth in the early 2000s, recalling genuine human connections and learning in communities like IRC and phpBB forums.

Today, distinguishing human from AI is increasingly difficult, as evidenced by AI-altered photos on LinkedIn and pervasive AI-generated "horror stories" on various social media platforms. The author expresses sadness and hopelessness over the mass availability of AI, which facilitates the creation of "AI-slop" and raises concerns about a future where bots interact mainly with other bots, and human knowledge is merely recycled for commercial gain, questioning the ultimate utility and original purpose of the internet and technology itself.
chinese_title: 死亡互联网理论
chinese_summary:
作者回忆了在HackerNews上的一次经历，当时一个开源项目被指控是AI生成的。尽管项目作者否认了，但文章作者却在他们的评论中观察到类似AI的语言模式（例如，特定破折号的使用，以及“你绝对正确”之类的短语），这导致作者对网络互动的真实性产生了深刻的不确定性。这一经历让他想起了“死寂互联网理论”。

死寂互联网理论认为，大约从2016年起，互联网就主要被机器人和机器生成的内容所占据，这主要是为了营销和SEO目的。作者将此与自己2000年代初的青春时期进行对比，回忆起在IRC和phpBB论坛等社区中真实的人际连接和学习。

如今，区分人类和AI变得越来越困难，这一点从LinkedIn上AI篡改的照片以及各种社交媒体平台上泛滥的AI生成“恐怖故事”可见一斑。作者对AI的大规模普及表示悲伤和绝望，这助长了“AI糟粕”的产生，并引发了对未来机器人主要与其他机器人互动、人类知识仅仅被回收用于商业利益的担忧，进而质疑了互联网和技术本身的最终效用和最初目的。

title: Apple testing new App Store design that blurs the line between ads and results
summary:
Apple is testing a new App Store design on iOS 26.3 that blurs the distinction between search ads and organic results. The key change is the removal of the blue background that previously highlighted sponsored results. Now, the only differentiator for an ad is a small 'Ad' banner next to the app icon, making it harder for users to quickly identify paid placements.

This design is currently in an A/B test phase and may be linked to Apple's December announcement that App Store search results would soon include multiple sponsored ads per query. By removing the blue background, all ads will appear more integrated within the search list.

While this change is not ideal for user experience, as it could mislead users into unknowingly clicking on ads, it is expected to increase click-through rates and ultimately boost Apple's advertising revenue. Apple has been contacted for clarity on a wider rollout.
chinese_title: 苹果正在测试新的App Store设计，模糊了广告与搜索结果的界限。
chinese_summary:
苹果正在iOS 26.3上测试一项新的App Store设计，该设计模糊了搜索广告与自然结果之间的界限。关键变化在于移除了此前用于突出显示赞助结果的蓝色背景。现在，广告唯一的区别标志是应用图标旁边的一个小小的“广告”标识，这使得用户更难快速识别付费位置。

这项设计目前处于A/B测试阶段，并可能与苹果去年12月宣布App Store搜索结果将很快在每次查询中包含多个赞助广告的声明有关。通过移除蓝色背景，所有广告在搜索列表中将显得更具整合性。

尽管这一改变对用户体验并不理想，因为它可能误导用户无意中点击广告，但预计会提高点击率，并最终提升苹果的广告收入。已就此项设计的更广泛推广计划联系了苹果公司以寻求澄清。

title: Level S4 solar radiation event
summary: On January 19, 2026, a G4 (Severe) Geomagnetic Storm occurred. G4 levels were first reached at 19:38 UTC (2:38 PM EST) on that date, triggered by the arrival of a Coronal Mass Ejection (CME) shock. The passage of the CME is expected to continue through the evening, making it possible for G4 storm levels to persist. The information about this event was published on Monday, January 19, 2026, at 20:09 UTC.
chinese_title: Level S4 solar radiation event
chinese_summary: 2026年1月19日，发生了一场G4（严重）地磁暴。当日世界时19时38分（美国东部时间下午2时38分），G4级别首次达到，由日冕物质抛射（CME）冲击波的到来引发。预计该CME的通过将持续到晚上，使得G4风暴级别可能持续。关于此次事件的信息于2026年1月19日（星期一）世界时20时09分发布。

title: Radboud University selects Fairphone as standard smartphone for employees
summary:
Radboud University has selected Fairphone as the standard smartphone for its employees, effective February 1, 2026. This decision stems from the university's commitment to sustainability, cost efficiency, and streamlined management.

Fairphones are highly sustainable, featuring easily replaceable components like batteries and screens to extend their lifespan. Production prioritizes fair and recycled materials, along with ensuring good working conditions.

While new Fairphones will be issued by the Information & Library Services (ILS) division, the university will first re-issue available used Samsung devices that meet technical and age requirements. Employees with existing university-issued iPhones can continue using them until they no longer function, but no new iPhones will be issued. Staff may also use their private phones for work with an RU SIM card, though device costs will not be reimbursed. All existing university and privately used work phones will continue to receive ILS support.

Standardizing on Fairphone is expected to reduce total costs due to the devices' longer lifespan. Managing a single model simplifies purchasing, stock, support, and training, leading to faster incident handling and replacements. This move aligns with Radboud University's circularity strategy, which focuses on maximizing the use and reuse of ICT hardware, supported by Fairphone's five-year warranty and up to eight years of software support.
chinese_title: 拉德堡德大学选用公平手机作为员工的标配智能手机
chinese_summary:
拉德堡德大学已选定Fairphone作为其员工的标准智能手机，自2026年2月1日起生效。这一决定源于大学对可持续性、成本效益和精简化管理的承诺。

Fairphone具有高度可持续性，其电池和屏幕等组件易于更换，从而延长了使用寿命。其生产优先使用公平和回收材料，并确保良好的工作条件。

虽然新的Fairphone将由信息与图书馆服务部（ILS）发放，但大学将首先重新发放符合技术和年限要求的现有二手三星设备。现有大学发放的iPhone用户可以继续使用，直到设备无法正常工作，但将不再发放新的iPhone。员工也可以使用自己的私人手机进行工作，并配备RU SIM卡，但设备费用将不予报销。所有现有大学和私人使用的办公手机将继续获得ILS支持。

统一使用Fairphone预计将因设备寿命更长而降低总成本。管理单一型号可简化采购、库存、支持和培训，从而实现更快的事件处理和设备更换。此举符合拉德堡德大学的循环经济战略，该战略侧重于最大限度地利用和再利用ICT硬件，并得到了Fairphone五年硬件保修和长达八年软件支持的保障。

title: Amazon is ending all inventory commingling as of March 31, 2026
summary:
The provided content does not contain an article about Amazon ending inventory commingling.

Instead, the text is a technical error message from x.com (formerly Twitter) stating, "We’ve detected that JavaScript is disabled in this browser. Please enable JavaScript or switch to a supported browser to continue using x.com." It prompts the user to access its Help Center, Services, Privacy, Cookie Policy, Imprint, and Ads info, concluding with a copyright notice for X Corp. dated 2026.

Therefore, it is impossible to summarize an article about Amazon's inventory policy based on the given content, as the actual article is missing and replaced by a website accessibility notice. The only information available related to the title is the title itself: "Amazon is ending all inventory commingling as of March 31, 2026."
chinese_title: 亚马逊将于2026年3月31日起停止所有库存混储。
chinese_summary:
提供的內容不包含有關亞馬遜終止庫存混儲的文章。

相反，該文本是來自x.com（前身為Twitter）的一條技術錯誤消息，內容是：“我們檢測到此瀏覽器中JavaScript已禁用。請啟用JavaScript或切換到受支持的瀏覽器以繼續使用x.com。”它提示用戶訪問其幫助中心、服務、隱私、Cookie政策、版本信息和廣告信息，最後以X公司2026年的版權聲明結束。

因此，根據所提供內容，無法總結一篇關於亞馬遜庫存政策的文章，因為實際文章缺失，並被網站可訪問性通知取代。唯一與標題相關的信息就是標題本身：“亞馬遜將於2026年3月31日終止所有庫存混儲。”

title: What came first: the CNAME or the A record?
summary:
On January 8, 2026, Cloudflare's 1.1.1.1 DNS resolver experienced a widespread outage due to a subtle change in how it ordered records in DNS responses. A memory optimization inadvertently caused CNAME (Canonical Name) records to sometimes appear *after* final A/AAAA records, instead of before them, when merging partially cached CNAME chains.

This reordering broke specific DNS client implementations, such as `getaddrinfo` in glibc (common on Linux) and certain Cisco ethernet switches. These clients process records sequentially, expecting CNAMEs to appear first to correctly resolve alias chains. When A records came first, they were ignored, leading to resolution failures or device reboots. Other clients, like `systemd-resolved`, parse all records into an unordered set before processing, avoiding this issue.

The incident highlighted a 40-year-old ambiguity in RFC 1034 (1987), which states responses may be "prefaced" by CNAMEs but lacks normative language ("MUST" or "SHOULD"). While the RFC clarifies that order within Resource Record Sets (RRsets) is insignificant, it doesn't explicitly define the ordering of different RRsets (like CNAMEs vs. A records) within a message section.

Cloudflare has reverted the change, committing to ensure CNAMEs appear before other records. To prevent future confusion and enhance protocol clarity, they have submitted an Internet-Draft to the IETF, proposing explicit requirements for CNAME ordering in DNS responses.
